content.description:
Tenuous climbing up a sharp, steep wall. The almost featureless terrain and dead vertical face require technique and willpower. Stay on your game for the surprise finish!

Getting off the ground is a crux in its own, make a few tedious moves off the start and clip the first two bolts. From here work up and right towards the real crux that follows after a small bulge. Break through the middle ground using tight, thin crimps and delicate edging. A few small pockets offer relief, but most of the work is up to you. Get a quick rest and fire the remaining moves to the anchor. Super rock. Super line.
content.location:
Under the Knife

is the fourth route in from the left. It is just right of

Diminished Capacity

.

content.description: Climb vertical and very technical rock to a juggy but pumpy top out.
content.location: From the main wall walk right around the corner, first route encountered. (Left most route)

content.description: Some funky, yet good climbing with a hand jam thrown in for good measure...
Start with a short boulder problem off the ground to gain awesome flake. Shake out, then  punch it through a balancy in-obvious crux sequence to chains.
content.location: One route right of CODE BLUE 12d. Look for flake

content.description: It's alive!!!! Wow, this rock is strange AF! Most definitely reminds me of sharp coral...don't wipe out bro! Little razor spindles of precipitated calcite cover this "flow stone". The middle of this route offers about 15 feet of good climbing but the rest is unfortunately kinda shit. It looks so intriguing from the bottom, but it just doesn't really ever "come together". Begin under a 4 foot roof and paste yourself upward into a tricky shallow left facing and left leaning corner for three bolts...awkward, insecure, unpleasant...about 12b. Next exit out right over the overlap created from the left leaning corner using some cool pinches to reach out right to a good rest horn. Above this shake, clamber up the sharp flow stone upwards for your fifteen feet of fame powering through some great underlings. Finish by tweaking up sharp scrappy holds for the unpleasant and burly crux just before the last bolt. It's short savage and sharp. Clip the chains while wishing this climb would have been more fun.
content.location: Found to the west of the blue wall about 50 yards. Follow the traversing trail from below the Blue Wall belay terrace to the west around the little buttress and you'll find yourself in the Coral Gables alcove. Coral Gables is the 3rd route from the left. It starts in the shallow left facing left leaning corner that "hangs" 4 feet off the ground. There are five routes total in this small zone.

content.description: Enjoyable, more technical climbing on small holds.  First route to the left of Cyberslit's shallow corner.
Begin on small ledge to gain first bolt. From ledge begin crimping on perfect blue limestone. Lots of great movement on small holds. Best stone in AF !
content.location: First route right of UNDER THE KNIFE 11d

content.description: Powerful side pulls and underclings lead to easier terrain at the top.
content.location: This route is inbetween Cortical Suppression and Coitus Frustratus.

content.description:
Climb up a steepening face with good edges low, small edges and pocket in the disconcerting crux, and gritty climbing on slightly less steep terrain at the top.

Fun movement, but bolted with the possibility of a damaging fall onto the less-than-vertical face in a couple of locations. You really mustn't fall in those locations.
content.protection: 6 bolts, single ring anchors. First two bolts shared with the line to the left.
content.location: Second from left, shares first two bolts with crack line to the left.

content.description:
An easy face up to a fun, mostly hand-sized, irregular crack. The inside of the crack is sharp, so don't wiggle around once you get your hand set.

If only the crack bit were longer...
content.protection: 7 bolts, single ring anchors. First two bolts are shared with the line to the right.
content.location: Left-most route on the wall; obvious crack.
